pros: Work life balance is excellent. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of their work. Interesting projects. Good extended health benefits and pension plan. Many managers and directors are genuinely caring and inspiring.

review_title: Rot in areas of this agency
cons:
I have never worked for such a horrible boss. 

There are great programs and staff that work hard for the community, but there is definitely rot in areas of this organization. When I stood up for myself and fellow staff, not only did they try to hush me as soon as the words left my mouth, but they created outright lies, denied any wrongdoing and spun it, coming at me as though I was a bug that needed to be squashed. It seems reputation and ego is everything to them, and instead of confronting and investigating internal issues, the answer is to fire any and all staff that expose unsettling internal treatment of their employees. I definitely did not expect this from an agency that is supposed to serve the vulnerable. I guess that doesn't include lower-level staff. They seemed to put a lot of effort into making me feel small and insignificant, and implement abusive strategies when I'd try to stand up for myself. I truly cherished my coworkers and the work I did, and am still in shock by the negative outcome with ACS. 

Be careful, and trust your gut.

job_title: Marketing Communications Manager in Abbotsford, BC
pros: It's great to be a part of such a great organization dedicated to helping the community. The work hours are flexible for most positions and full-time employees are eligible for benefits and a pension. Management is very supportive and there is room for growth.
cons: It can be overwhelming to get to know all of the 400+ employees and the scope of the 90+ programs.

pros: ACS walks the talk.  The agency is committed to their mission and vision.  To be part of the team means you are respected, valued and given the opportunity to do your best work.
